title: Special Piping and Storage Systems
body: User notes:About this chapter: Chapter 22 addresses fuel oil piping and storage related to oil-fired heating appliances. Materials, joining methods, tanks, pumps, valves and installation of such are covered.Code development reminder: Code change proposals to this chapter will be considered by the IRC—Plumbing/Mechanical Code Development Committee during the 2021 (Group A) Code Development Cycle.

section: Chapter 22 Special Piping and Storage Systems
title: Oil Tanks

section: Chapter 22 Special Piping and Storage Systems
title: Materials
body: Supply tanks shall be listed and labeled and shall conform to UL 80 for indoor tanks.

section: Chapter 22 Special Piping and Storage Systems
title: Above-Ground Tanks
body: The maximum amount of fuel oil stored inside a building shall be 660 gallons (2498 L). The supply tank shall be supported on rigid noncombustible supports to prevent settling or shifting. Exception: The storage of fuel oil, used for space or water heating, inside buildings in quantities exceeding 660 gallons (2498 L) shall comply with NFPA 31.

section: Chapter 22 Special Piping and Storage Systems
title: Tanks Within Buildings
body: Supply tanks for use inside of buildings shall be of such size and shape to permit installation and removal from dwellings as whole units. Supply tanks larger than 10 gallons (38 L) shall be placed not less than 5 feet (1524 mm) from any fire or flame either within or external to any fuel-burning appliance.

section: Chapter 22 Special Piping and Storage Systems
title: Underground Tanks
body: Excavations for underground tanks shall not undermine the foundations of existing structures.

section: Chapter 22 Special Piping and Storage Systems
title: Multiple Tanks
body: Cross connection of two supply tanks shall be permitted in accordance with Section M2203.6.

section: Chapter 22 Special Piping and Storage Systems
title: Oil Gauges
body: Inside tanks shall be provided with a device to indicate when the oil in the tank has reached a predetermined safe level. Glass gauges or a gauge subject to breakage that could result in the escape of oil from the tank shall not be used. Liquid-level indicating gauges shall comply with UL 180.

section: Chapter 22 Special Piping and Storage Systems
title: Oil Piping, Fitting and Connections

section: Chapter 22 Special Piping and Storage Systems
title: Materials
body: Piping shall consist of steel pipe, copper and copper-alloy pipe and tubing, steel tubing conforming to ASTM A539, or stainless steel tubing conforming to ASTM A254 or ASTM A269. Aluminum tubing shall not be used between the fuel-oil tank and the burner units.

section: Chapter 22 Special Piping and Storage Systems
title: Joints and Fittings
body: Piping shall be connected with fittings compatible with the piping material. Cast-iron fittings shall not be used for oil piping. Unions requiring gaskets or packings, right or left couplings, and sweat fittings employing solder having a melting point less than 1,000°F (538°C) shall not be used for oil piping. Threaded joints and connections shall be made tight with a lubricant or pipe thread compound.

section: Chapter 22 Special Piping and Storage Systems
title: Flexible Connectors
body: Flexible metallic hoses shall be listed and labeled in accordance with UL 536 and shall be installed in accordance with their listing and labeling and the manufacturer's installation instructions. Connectors made from combustible materials shall not be used inside of buildings or above ground outside of buildings.

section: Chapter 22 Special Piping and Storage Systems
title: Installation

section: Chapter 22 Special Piping and Storage Systems
title: General
body: Piping shall be installed in a manner to avoid placing stresses on the piping, and to accommodate expansion and contraction of the piping system.

section: Chapter 22 Special Piping and Storage Systems
title: Supply Piping
body: Supply piping used in the installation of oil burners and appliances shall be not smaller than 3/8-inch (9 mm) pipe or 3/8-inch (9 mm) outside diameter tubing. Copper tubing and fittings shall be Type L or heavier.

section: Chapter 22 Special Piping and Storage Systems
title: Fill Piping
body: Fill piping shall terminate outside of buildings at a point not less than 2 feet (610 mm) from any building opening at the same or lower level. Fill openings shall be equipped with a tight metal cover.

section: Chapter 22 Special Piping and Storage Systems
title: Vent Piping
body: Vent piping shall be not smaller than 11/4-inch (32 mm) pipe. Vent piping shall be laid to drain toward the tank without sags or traps in which the liquid can collect. Vent pipes shall not be cross connected with fill pipes, lines from burners or overflow lines from auxiliary tanks. The lower end of a vent pipe shall enter the tank through the top and shall extend into the tank not more than 1 inch (25 mm).

section: Chapter 22 Special Piping and Storage Systems
title: Vent Termination
body: Vent piping shall terminate outside of buildings at a point not less than 2 feet (610 mm), measured vertically or horizontally, from any building opening. Outer ends of vent piping shall terminate in a weather-proof cap or fitting having an unobstructed area equal to or greater than the cross-sectional area of the vent pipe, and shall be located sufficiently above the ground to avoid being obstructed by snow and ice.

section: Chapter 22 Special Piping and Storage Systems
title: Cross Connection of Tanks
body: Cross connection of two supply tanks, not exceeding 660 gallons (2498 L) aggregate capacity, with gravity flow from one tank to another, shall be acceptable providing that the two tanks are on the same horizontal plane.

section: Chapter 22 Special Piping and Storage Systems
title: Oil Pumps and Valves

section: Chapter 22 Special Piping and Storage Systems
title: Pumps
body: Oil pumps shall be positive displacement types that automatically shut off the oil supply when stopped. Automatic pumps shall be listed and labeled in accordance with UL 343 and shall be installed in accordance with their listing.

section: Chapter 22 Special Piping and Storage Systems
title: Shutoff Valves
body: A manual shutoff valve shall be installed between the oil supply tank and the burner. Such valve shall be provided with ready access. Where the shutoff valve is installed in the discharge line of an oil pump, a pressure relief valve shall be incorporated to bypass or return surplus oil. Valves shall comply with UL 842.

section: Chapter 22 Special Piping and Storage Systems
title: Maximum Pressure
body: Pressure at the oil supply inlet to an appliance shall be not greater than 3 pounds per square inch (20.7 kPa).

section: Chapter 22 Special Piping and Storage Systems
title: Relief Valves
body: Fuel-oil lines incorporating heaters shall be provided with relief valves that will discharge to a return line when excess pressure exists.
